CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 25, 1958, pg. A4, reads: "'Stormy' Carried to the Cemetery - The remains of George Griffin, better known as 'Stormy Weather,' are moved for interment from West Funeral Parlors where burial services were held last week. He died suddenly.  Six of 'Stormy's' countless friends served as pallbearers.  They are James Sheldon, Floyd Dawson, Luther E. Watkins, James D. Wells, Harvey Kates and Edward Wade.  in rear center is a staff member of the funeral parlors. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Men and women exiting West's Funeral Home for funeral of George "Stormy Weather" Griffin, 2216 Centre Avenue, Hill District
